docs.title: IT Dokumentation
docs.text: Dokumentation af IT-værktøjer og arbejdsgange til hurtig reference.

docs.title: Indhold
docs.text:
• Terminal – Terminal og kommandolinje
  • Markdown – Markdown syntaks og brug
  • Navngivning – Navngivningskonventioner (PEP 8)
  • Claude Setup – Opsætning af Claude

docs.title: Kodning
docs.text:
• Cursor – Cursor IDE
  • Git & GitHub – Git og GitHub
  • uv – Python pakkehåndtering med uv

docs.title: CLAUDE.md files
docs.text:
• The global CLAUDE.md file is in ~/.claude folder
  • Place project local CLAUDE.md file in the root of project folders
  • Place sub locals in sub folders

docs.title: Standards for Claude
docs.text:
• Descriptions of my standards is is the ~/.claude/prompts folder. Always name these as name-standards.md
  • Tell Claude to use name-standards.md in the global CLAUDE.md file.

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• # Section
  • ## Subsection

docs.title: Fonts
docs.text:
• ** for bold
  • `` for code style format

docs.title: Naming Conventions
docs.text:
This document defines the naming conventions used across the project following PEP 8 standards. The goal is consistency, readability, and low friction across code, data, and operations.

When something is not explicitly covered here, follow the most common pattern already used in the project.

docs.title: General Rules
docs.text:
• Use English for all technical names
  • Avoid abbreviations unless they are widely understood (id, url, api)
  • Use ASCII only (a–z, 0–9)
  • Avoid spaces and special characters
  • Prefer consistency over creativity

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Convention Example Characteristics Typical Use snake_case technical_name Lowercase, words separated by underscore Python (variables, functions, methods, modules, files and directories), database tables/columns PascalCase TechnicalName Starts with uppercase, each word capitalized Python (classes, exceptions) SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE TECHNICAL_NAME Uppercase, underscores Python constants, environment variables _leading_underscore _internal_var Single underscore prefix Python internal/private use (convention) __double_underscore __private_attr Double underscore prefix Python name mangling (class-private) dunder init Double underscore on both sides Python magic/special methods kebab-case technical-name Lowercase, hyphens URLs, filenames and directories dot.case technical.name Words separated by dots Configuration keys, logging

docs.title: Variables
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case
  • Use descriptive names
  • Boolean variables should use prefixes: is_, has_, can_, should_

Examples:

user_id = 123
total_price = 99.95
is_authenticated = True
has_permission = False

docs.title: Functions and Methods
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case
  • Functions should be named using verbs
  • Keep names descriptive but concise

Examples:

def calculate_total_price():
    pass

def get_user_by_id(user_id):
    pass

def is_valid_email(email):
    pass

docs.title: Classes
docs.text:
• Format: PascalCase (CapWords)
  • Use nouns or noun phrases

Examples:

class UserAccount:
    pass

class PaymentService:
    pass

class OrderProcessor:
    pass

docs.title: Exceptions
docs.text:
• Format: PascalCase
  • Should end with Error suffix

Examples:

class ValidationError(Exception):
    pass

class DatabaseConnectionError(Exception):
    pass

docs.title: Constants
docs.text:
• Format: SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE
  • Define at module level

Examples:

MAX_RETRY_COUNT = 3
DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS = 30
API_BASE_URL = "https://api.example.com"

docs.title: Modules and Packages
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case (modules) / lowercase (packages)
  • Keep names short
  • Avoid underscores in package names if possible

Examples:

data_processor.py      # module
payment_handler.py     # module
mypackage/             # package
utils/                 # package

docs.title: Private and Internal
docs.text:
• Single underscore _ prefix: internal use (convention only)
  • Double underscore __ prefix: triggers name mangling in classes

Examples:

class MyClass:
    def __init__(self):
        self._internal_value = 10      # internal use
        self.__private_value = 20      # name mangling

    def _helper_method(self):          # internal method
        pass

docs.title: Magic Methods (Dunder)
docs.text:
• Format: __name__
  • Only use Python's predefined magic methods

Examples:

def __init__(self):
    pass

def __str__(self):
    return "string representation"

def __len__(self):
    return self._count

docs.title: Files and Directories
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case for Python files and python directories
  • Format: kebab-case for non-Python files and directories
  • Lowercase only

Examples:

payment_service.py
user_authentication.py
data-analysis-report.md

docs.title: Documentation Files
docs.text:
• Use kebab-case
  • Prefix with ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD) when ordering matters

Example:

2026-02-architecture-decisions.md

docs.title: Tables and Columns
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case
  • Lowercase only

Examples:

user_preferences
created_at
updated_at

docs.title: Keys
docs.text:
• Primary key: id
  • Foreign key: <table>_id

Examples:

user_id
order_id

docs.title: Endpoints
docs.text:
• Format: kebab-case
  • Use nouns, not verbs
  • Use plural form where appropriate

Examples:

GET /api/user-preferences
POST /api/orders

docs.title: JSON Payloads
docs.text:
• Format: snake_case (Python convention)

Example:

{
  "user_id": 123,
  "email_notifications_enabled": true
}

docs.title: HTTP Headers
docs.text:
• Format: kebab-case

Example:

x-request-id

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
• Format: SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE

Examples:

DATABASE_URL
REDIS_HOST
LOG_LEVEL

docs.title: Configuration Keys
docs.text:
• Format: dot.case

Examples:

feature.new.checkout
logging.level.api

docs.title: Exceptions
docs.text:
• Files with established ecosystem conventions follow those conventions:
  • README.md
  • LICENSE
  • Makefile
  • pyproject.toml
  • setup.py
  • Auto-generated files must not be manually modified

docs.title: Quick Reference (PEP 8)
docs.text: Type Convention Example Variable snake_case user_count Function snake_case get_user() Method snake_case calculate_total() Class PascalCase UserAccount Exception PascalCase + Error ValidationError Constant SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE MAX_RETRIES Module snake_case data_processor.py Package lowercase mypackage Private _leading_underscore _internal_var Magic dunder __init__

docs.title: Changes
docs.text: Changes to this document require: - Team agreement - Updates to existing code where applicable

docs.title: Common commands
docs.text:
• cd .. or cd folder
  • mkdir make directory
  • ls list content of directory, ls -a include hidden files
  • open -a TextEdit filename opens file in TextEdit
    • use ~/ as root. ~ is typed as Option+¨ (right to the Å-key)

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: • open settings CMD + ,

docs.title: Første gang i et nyt projekt:
docs.text:
• git init

  • git add .

  • git commit -m "First commit"

  • git branch -M main

  • git remote add origin https://github.com/brugernavn/repo.git

  • git push -u origin main

docs.title: Efterfølgende:
docs.text:
• git add .

  • git commit -m "Fixet X, tilføjet Y"

  • git push

docs.title: 1. Start et nyt projekt
docs.text: • git init

docs.title: 2. Tjek status
docs.text: • git status

docs.title: 3. Tilføj ændringer til staging
docs.text:
• git add filnavn.py Tilføj en bestemt fil

  • git add . Tilføj alt

docs.title: 4. Commit dine ændringer
docs.text: • git commit -m "Beskrivelse af ændringer"

docs.title: 5. Opret forbindelse til GitHub
docs.text: • git remote add origin git@github.com:larsgam/repo.git

docs.title: 6. Push første gang (ny branch)
docs.text:
• git push -u origin main

  • git push Al efterfølgende push

docs.title: 7. Hent ændringer fra GitHub
docs.text: • git pull

docs.title: 8. Branching
docs.text:
• git branch feature-navn Opret en branch

  • git switch feature-navn Skift til branch

  • git switch -c feature-navn Opret + skift

  • git branch Se branches

docs.title: 9. Merge en branch ind i main
docs.text:
• git switch main

  • git merge feature-navn

docs.title: 10. Se commit-historik
docs.text:
• git log --oneline Kort historik

  • git log Fuld historik

docs.title: 11. Undo og reset (mest brugt)
docs.text:
• git restore --staged filnavn.py Fjern fil fra staging

  • git restore filnavn.py Tilbagefør ændringer i fil

docs.title: 12. Klon et GitHub-repo
docs.text: • git clone git@github.com:larsgam/repo.git

docs.title: 13. Sæt main som default branch (hvis projekt starter med master)
docs.text: • git branch -M main

docs.title: 14. Se forskelle
docs.text: • git diff

docs.title: New project
docs.text:
• In terminal go to the folder in which the new project should be in (e.g. ~code/projects/)

  • Make a folder with the wanted projectname, mkdir projectname

  • go to the project folder cd projectname

  • type uv init projectname

  • this creates the following files in the projectfolder

  • main.py

  • pyprojet.toml

  • README.md

  • Open VsCode by typing code or Cursor by typing cursor in Terminal from the projectfolder

docs.title: Add Python packages to the uv virtual environmen
docs.text: • Type uv add numpy

docs.title: Add Marimo
docs.text: • Type `uv add "marimo[recommended]"

docs.title: Start Marimo
docs.text:
• uv run marimo edit file.py

  • uv run marimo run file.py
